## The kunoichi palette

In an [earlier post](/post/colour-palettes/) I created the *kunoichi* palette. This is an example of a project page that uses this user-generated palette. 

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(slumdown)

ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) + 
  geom_point() + theme_slum("kunoichi")
```

A gganimate version:

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(gganimate)
bridges <- read_csv("/data/brownian_bridges.csv")

b <- ggplot(
  data = bridges,
  mapping = aes(
    x = Horizontal,
    y = Vertical,
    colour = factor(Series))
) +
  geom_point(
    show.legend = FALSE,
    size = 4) +
  coord_equal() +
  xlim(-1.5, 1) +
  ylim(-1.25, 1.25) + 
  theme_slum("kunoichi")

b + facet_wrap(vars(Time))
```
